text: This is a perfect place for creative and hard-working individuals who find comfort in routine and consistency. Co-workers are friendly and management is supportive and professional. Grateful for the time spent at Melissa and Doug.
This place here is horrible to work at. Equipment is bad. No room to stage freight even in the overflow. Pay is horrible. Management sucks. This place only goes off favoritism

Definitely busy and keep you on your toes. Could do with more structure among contracted staff. Need more people to accomplish their goals as contracted staff often had job responsibility changes unexpectedly.
Worked there many years ago. Give you the chance to learn something new based on your performance. Management was friendly and always had the time to listen to your concerns.
Negotiate Salary ahead of time, very busy work not much in the way of help, at least while I was there! More oriented to Sales people and toy designers
They talk a good game in the interview process. Ends up being about looking out for who goes out for drinks and strip clubs with management that gets ahead quickly.
Ok job to work for. Ppl nice just a little unorganized at times. Over all I had a good experience at this location. Yes I would recommend working for this company.

If you have an idea to improve the company in anyway, management will let you run with that idea. Regardless if you‚Äôre associate, manager, senior leader. It‚Äôs great to feel that your voice is heard. Many managers are great with work place flexibility and understand life happens outside of work.

They pretend like they're interested in customers and the people they sell toys to, but they're only interested in the bottom line. They discard people like they were nothing and they have never appreciated the hard work that their employees do for

If you‚Äôre great at your job, you‚Äôll find yourself here for many years with very little increase in pay. Low chances of hire on (everyone starts off through an agency) or moving up the scale. Warehouse is a mess and there is no control whatsoever.

These people pretend that they care about childhood and giving back to the community but they don‚Äôt. All they care about is the bottom line. In 2020 they gave toys away to children in Wilton, CT where money is not an issue but they charged parents for
no thank you! worked in sales for 2 years and it was a total waste of time. only good thing about it was the co-workers. some of the best people ever.

Lies and manipulation are at the forefront of this organization. You are treated like dirt, and when they no longer have any use for you, you will be spit on, and kicked to the curb like a piece of garbage. There is no heart here.
This was the worst job I ever had, terrible management terrible owners, horrible work conditions. Micro management like you are a child. Psycho owners

Amazing toys for kids. Very nice image and presentation of what we stand for to the general public. However, it is a shame management has poor management skills with no prior managerial acumen before coming here. There is a new regime that I hope
Good place to work and good coworkers.Stating working there you just find out people just like you. People moving on living there life‚Äôs helping each other‚Äôs out.
The work was excellent team work it was always on track work never got out of hand or mislead its a great job to start a warehouse job for experience.

A typical day starts with signing in to work an taking your place in your usual team briefing position where you are briefed on the logistics of the the days tasks and reminded of the expectations of the club from you for the task ahead then the fun day at work starts.
On midweek game you are very luck to get out at 11pm. Keep you behind for no apparent reason. Management stand around doing nothing. Only act as if they are working when top brass come in.
Very supportive environment from the head coaches. Weekly session planned required at FDC which aids learning and made sure of best session put on for developing players.

very good place to work if you are interested in football as we got to watch quite a few of the Chelsea home matches as we was allocated seats in the ground for us and the young people we taught football to/
People I worked for were inexperienced managers. Once coaches now office men with no managing skills. Couldn't have asked for better colleagues ! Also located at the training ground was good.

outstanding team, company and facility, to be apart of an iconic and amazing team was priceless, moving the experience for customer to the next level was rewarding and privileged. more details in my CV

day to day variety which makes days less mundane and more productive. Management are easily approachable and understanding. This is an ideal job for students due to the flexibility (what you put in is what you get out) environment.
Real attention to the detail and the customer experience is taken by all to provide the customers within the stadium a high quality and memorable experience.
Being a Chelsea fan, working there was a dream come through, getting to meet the players face to face and get a feel of the atmosphere was incredible.
lovely staff and managers, always willing to help. team work requires effort and union. very wide cultural work environment and good people to work with.
A general day at work consists of me serving to the guests drinks & food that was at the stadium for the game. I also learnt how to stick to deadlines.

Throughout my time working at Chelsea Football club I ran coaching sessions throughout the summer at CFC's soccer camps. I learnt how to adapt my coaching sessions and communication depending on the age group and ability of my players.

Working for Chelsea FC Foundation was a very great place to work, everyday sharing my passion for football with the younger generations. Chelsea FC Foundation as a company was very good to work for as they cared, gave me great opportunities to progress

As I'm into sport this was one of the best places that I have worked in, the people were great & the job too. Day to day collecting post from different sections of the stadium & sending out for posting Very hard on feet , so good footware is vital.

God company to work for and good benefits. Interacting with VIP clients, aupervising waiting staff. I learnt communication skills with a range of clients and how to manage staff at a supervisor level.

Good workplace due to the nature of the job , good experience , colleagues excellent , assisting coaches is good because I learn a lot from the other coaches and this will help in the future as I want to have a job within sports

It is a great job for those who need flexible work days, and another great thing about the job is that you can continue each season so you know once you have gotten the job you will have it for next season too.

I am currently a casual coach within the Chelsea Foundation Hampshire department, delivering various multi sport sessions in the Hampshire community. Working life at Chelsea is very good, the management is great as they allow you to fit the work

It was always a fun time at work due to the amount of young people however a lot of hard work was done evry shift i learnt how to deal with customers look after my own section all things that can be taken to another job.
